qas.question: What was Eisenhower's favorite hobby other than golfing?
Who notably painted a picture of Mamie Eisenhower?
What was the main type of oil painting painted by Eisenhower?
What car did Eisenhower compare modern art to?
Who called Eisenhower's art "simple and earnest"?

context: After golf, <a0_0>oil painting<a0_0/> was Eisenhower's second hobby. While at Columbia University, Eisenhower began the art after watching <a1_0>Thomas E. Stephens<a1_0/> paint Mamie's portrait. Eisenhower painted about 260 oils during the last 20 years of his life to relax, mostly <a2_0>landscapes<a2_0/> but also portraits of subjects such as Mamie, their grandchildren, General Montgomery, George Washington, and Abraham Lincoln. <a4_0>Wendy Beckett<a4_0/> stated that Eisenhower's work, "simple and earnest, rather cause us to wonder at the hidden depths of this reticent president". A conservative in both art and politics, he in a 1962 speech denounced modern art as "a piece of canvas that looks like a broken-down <a3_0>Tin Lizzie<a3_0/>, loaded with paint, has been driven over it."
